common_errors.pattern: ParseError|input not matching format|failed to parse date
common_errors.meaning: Date/time string does not match format spec
solutions: Include offset when using DateTime::parse_from_str with %z/%:z
Use chrono-tz for named zones instead of parsing abbreviations

common_errors.pattern: OutOfRange|value out of range|timestamp out of range
common_errors.meaning: Value cannot be represented by Chrono type
causes: Unix timestamp outside i64 seconds range
solutions: Clamp or validate input before constructing DateTime

common_errors.pattern: ambiguous local time|local time not available
causes: DST transition causing duplicate/invalid local time
Local timezone information missing or unsupported
solutions: Handle LocalResult variants instead of unwrap()
Use fixed offsets (FixedOffset) or chrono-tz named zones
Disambiguate with latest() or earliest() handling

common_errors.meaning: Formatter token invalid for provided type
causes: Using timezone directives on Naive types
Custom format string contains invalid escapes
solutions: Verify format string against Chrono docs

common_errors.pattern: chrono-tz data not found|unknown time zone
causes: Using abbreviation instead of IANA zone name
Stripped timezone data in minimal builds
solutions: Add chrono-tz dependency and use Tz enum: "Europe/Berlin".parse()
Ensure compiled binary includes tz data when cross-compiling
